title: Reunion At Dawn
opening: In the Holy Kingdom of Faerghus, Imperialist loyalist Cornelia has subdued all regions of the former royal house of Blaiddyd to prevent further revolt. Prince Dimitri has been sentenced. Now, the backbone of the former Kingdom–Houses Gautier and Fraldarius–struggle to continue the resistance. Cornelia–operating out of the royal palace–has accepted the support of the Empire to build an army and plots to wipe out all remaining Kingdom forces.

In the Leicester Alliance, House Riegan leads an anti-Imperial faction, while House Gloucester directs the Empire’s supporters. Despite the undeniable threat of fracture, the Alliance’s adept new leader, Claude, deftly maintains the outward appearance of a unified front.

In Enbarr, the Imperial Capital of the Adrestian Empire, Emperor Edelgard fights to strengthen her regime. She has extended her reach to the Kingdom by inciting a coup and continues to draw its former lords under her influence in pursuit of controlling all of western Fódlan.

In the meantime, the Knights of Seiros have been dispatched to find Archbishop Rhea, who remains missing despite their searching. Left unattended, the monastery at Garreg Mach has fallen to ruin…and become a haven for thieves.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: *sighs* Why am I even here? I know they won't come, but here I am anyway. How has it already been five years? Time stops for no one, I suppose.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Huh? It's-- It's you! What are you doing here?

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Highly doubtful. So you were alive. What have you been doing all this time?

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Joking at a time like this. Well if you don't wish to tell me, I won't persuade you. All that matters is this: Will you return to the Empire with me?

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Before you answer, know that friends from our Black Eagle days have chosen to join me in the fight ahead.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Hesitation. It betrays your true answer.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: As expected. I knew your answer before I had even asked the question.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: That means... we're enemies now, you and I. My teacher, the time for discussion has come to an end.

cutscene.speaker: Edelgard
cutscene.line: Even though our swords may cross as they do now--

cutscene.speaker: Edelgard
cutscene.line: --there's no denying that our chosen paths never will.

cutscene.speaker: Edelgard
cutscene.line: Goodbye, my teacher. When next we meet, one of us will breath their last.

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: Who is it?! Is that-- It's you!

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: It's been a long time.

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: Yes, it has been! But this is no time for casual chatter!

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: What are you doing here?

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: I was going to ask you the very same thing.

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: After you disappeared five years ago, do you have any idea how dire the church's situation became? Where were you, and what were you doing all of those years?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I was sleeping.

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: You slept for five years... In that case, I suppose there is nothing more to say. You should know that Rhea also disappeared after the battle at Garreg Mach five years ago. Since then, the knights have been fully devoted to searching for her. They have yet to find a trace.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Was she captured by the Imperial army?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Was she murdered by the Imperial army?

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: It is possible. However, the Empire has not made any such statement as of yet. Even if that were the truth, there is no way for us to confirm. We have searched all over, but we have reached an impasse. Unless we do something, our efforts to find Rhea and rebuild the Church will be stalled indefinitely. Our opportunity to strike back is close at hand. Sadly, we are short on military strength. However, now we have you. Do you recall what Rhea told you five years ago? She asked for you to take her place should anything ever happen to her. She entrusted you with leading the people of Fódlan.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I remember.

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: Then I beg of you, please, heed her words.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I can't do that.

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: I will not accept that. Please... you must lend me your strength.

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: It is up to you to lead us and to defeat the Empire-- no, to defeat Edelgard.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Why me?

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: There is a very good reason...but it is not yet time to divulge it. Just know that without you, we have no hope.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: You should lead them.

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: It is not for me to do. You are the only one who can rise to this task. Someday, you will know why that is. Until then, I ask that you trust me.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I don't want to fight Edelgard.

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: What are you saying? She is tormenting all of Fódlan! And you are the only one who can save us! How can you not see that?!

intro.speaker: Church Soldier
intro.line: Sir! Bandits have entered the area! They stole some hidden weapons and ran off! They're heading for the town, so that might be where they're hiding out...

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: Vile thieves! Even with the knights gone, I cannot believe they would dare trespass here! This is unforgivable! Come, Professor. Let us give chase!

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: Looters deserve no forgiveness! After them!

battle.speaker: Pallardó
battle.line: What the… Intruders! Protect the goods!

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: Stop the thieves! Retrieve our stolen goods!

battle.speaker: Dorothea
battle.line: We had no place to go so we came back to Garreg Mach. But then -- Huh? Professor?

battle.speaker: Caspar
battle.line: Looks like there's a fight! I'm ready to join the battle!

battle.speaker: Petra
battle.line: It is confirmed that Professor is alive. I will be...cooperating.

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: What are you doing here?! Never mind, we'll have to talk later! Help us with these thieves!

battle.speaker: Bernadetta
battle.line: People? A battle?! Oh, there wasn't supposed to be anyone here! Wait, is that... Professor?!

battle.speaker: Linhardt
battle.line: Professor... You're alive after all. Well then, I am quite pleased with my choice to come here.

battle.speaker: Ferdinand
battle.line: Professor?! Never mind... We have to focus on winning this fight!

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: Lend us a hand! Let's beat them back!

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: If we split our troops in two, we can attack from the north and the south to trap their leader.

battle-talk.speaker: Dorothea
battle-talk.line: Do you remember our promise from five years ago, Professor? Today's the day.

battle-talk.speaker: Caspar
battle-talk.line: I'm so glad I get to see you again, Professor!

battle-talk.speaker: Petra
battle-talk.line: I went back to Brigid once...but I had to be returning to Fódlan.

battle-talk.speaker: Ferdinand
battle-talk.line: Ah, Professor. You have not changed a bit. I am so glad to fight alongside you again.

battle-talk.speaker: Linhardt
battle-talk.line: So what have you been doing these past five years? Sleeping?! Why, I must say I'm a bit envious.

battle-talk.speaker: Bernadetta
battle-talk.line: Took all my will to come out here today. But seeing you again, Professor? That's worth a little torture!

boss.speaker: Pallardó
boss.line: No! I'm not the one you want! Gah! I guess I've got no choice.

boss.speaker: Pallardó
boss.line: It isn't looking good for us. Should we retreat?

boss.speaker: Seteth
boss.line: He has some treasure from the monastery too! Do not let him escape!

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: It seems we were able to expel the bandits who were hiding in Garreg Mach. How fortuitous that you students should gather at the monastery like this...

end.speaker: Dorothea
end.line: We made a promise with the professor. That was five years ago to the very day.

end.speaker: Petra
end.line: We all gave our promise to be meeting here when the millennium festival arrived.

end.speaker: Linhardt
end.line: Though the one who came up with that plan is not here... Edelgard. Still, how incredible that those present gathered despite the terrible state of things...

end.speaker: Caspar
end.line: Pfft, the most incredible part of it is that you didn't oversleep and miss the reunion!

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: So, that is the reason... Professor. The monastery is safe because of your devoted students. I am now fully convinced you are the only one who can save Fódlan.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: That's taking it a bit far.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: Ah, so you have finally accepted your destiny.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: On the very day I return to Garreg Mach, you awaken and return as well. This is no mere coincidence but, rather, the work of the goddess.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: What's your reason for being here?

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: Actually... Well, it would be easier to just show you. Come with me to the Holy Mausoleum. I realize that since you have been slumbering for so long, you have no idea what has transpired in the various territories. Allow me to explain... After the Battle of Garreg Mach, there was a change of regime in the Kingdom. House Blaiddyd suffered a series of brutal massacres, which claimed the lives of Dimitri and Regent Rufus. The Kingdom capital fell and was absorbed into the Empire as the Faerghus Dukedom, which is now under Cornelia's control. Some still resist the Empire. As of now, Rodrigue of House Fraldarius is at the center of such efforts. In the Alliance, Claude leads the faction that opposes the Empire, and Lorenz leads those who have sided with them. The front lines are ever in motion, but the war effort has stagnated overall. In short, both the Kingdom and the Alliance have been swallowed up by the Empire and are on the verge of collapse. We must gather our generals and soldiers under your command and reverse this dire situation.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: Flayn, look! The professor has returned to us!

end.speaker: Flayn
end.line: Hm? What do you mean... Oh! Goodness! It really IS you, Professor! I cannot believe you are still of this world! We were so worried we would never see you again.

end.speaker: Flayn
end.line: I forgot something important at the Holy Mausoleum... I told my brother I had to go back for it no matter what, and so here I am...

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: After we finished here, we were going to continue our search for Rhea. But now that you are here, things have changed. We must not waste this opportunity. We shall send word to the knights scattered all across the land. The time has come for the Knights of Seiros to return to action. We are counting on you, Professor!
